title: Lea Michele talks breakup songs in new album
title_page: Lea Michele talks breakup songs in new album | Daily Mail Online
text:
She's getting ready to release her highly-anticipated second studio album.
And on Thursday's Ellen DeGeneres Show, Lea Michele looked excited as she chatted with the comedienne about the upcoming record.
The 30-year-old multi-talented star admitted that the album, titled Places, will include a few break up songs, which allowed her to be honest with her fans and confront past relationships.
Scroll down for video
Confidence: On Thursday's Ellen DeGeneres Show, Lea Michele looked vibrant and excited as she chatted with the comedienne about the upcoming record
'I'm in a very positive place in my life - but of course, love has its ups and downs,' she began, 'And there's a few of those break up songs on the album.'
When the beloved morning show host prodded the Glee alumna to reveal who the songs are about, Michele hinted that listeners would have to guess that on their own.
'You don't want to give anyone or any story in particular more attention than it already deserves, but for me, my music is my time to be honest.
Who is it?! When the beloved morning show host prodded the Glee alumna to reveal who the songs are about, Michele hinted that listeners would have to guess that on their own
'So, be careful dating a singer or you might get Taylor Swifted!'
It's rumoured that a track on the album, named Hey You, is about Michele's boyfriend and Glee co-star Cory Monteith, who died in 2013 of heroin- and alcohol-induced toxicity.
Lea's other public relationships include Glee co-stars Matthew Morrison and Mark Salling, Theo Stockman, and Matthew Paetz.
'You might get Taylor Swifted!' Taylor has made a career from writing about exes in her songs
The Scream Queens star - looking flawless in a light mint dress with pink floral pattern by Saloni Official - also confessed that though she loved her first album, the second one hits closer to home.
She said: 'This album, for me, was kind of coming back to my roots. I'm in a different place in my life, I'm also not on a show where I'm singing all the time as well, so I can really just focus on this album. I'm going to be touring, it's really exciting.'
Ellen then suggested that she and Lea should add a photo to the actress's growing 'bed series' - a funny take on Mario Testino's Towel Series, in which Lea posts nearly naked photos from different beds she sleeps in while traveling.

The pair got on top of a bed onstage and posed for photos, even having a pretend pillow fight
The pair got on top of a bed onstage and posed for photos, even spooning for one.
Places is available for pre-order and is set for release on April 28.
The songstress has already released Love Is Alive and Anything Is Possible as the first two singles from the album.
